lines.text: I can see you're a true puritan, Bridie. Eh?
There's nothing wrong with that, Sir.
Of course not. There was a time when that was against the law you know.
Someone once called this law against homosexuality the blackmailer's charter.
Is that how you feel about it?
I'm a policeman, sir. I don't have feelings.
Well it used to be witches. At least they don't burn you.
